cultural_etiquette: Dress modestly when visiting Revdanda village areas.
Ask for 'Tikhat' (spicy) levels at local eateries; Konkani food is naturally fiery.
important_tips: Carry cash as network issues can make UPI payments slow at remote beaches.
Pre-book your return ferry to avoid getting stranded on Sunday evenings.

accommodation.booking_tip: Request a room on the first floor for better forest views.
accommodation.name: Silvanus Forest Retreat
accommodation.why_this: Offers a boutique experience nestled in greenery, close to the cleaner southern beaches.

activities.description: Experience a world-class ferry ride from Mumbai to Mandwa. Enjoy the open deck views of the Mumbai skyline and the Arabian Sea.
activities.google_maps_search_query: M2M Ferries, Ferry Wharf, Mazgaon, Mumbai, Maharashtra
activities.local_secret: The upper deck (Starboard side) offers the best views of the Taj Mahal Palace hotel as you depart.
activities.why_this_fits: It's the most scenic way to start a beach trip, bypassing 3 hours of road traffic.

activities.description: A legendary spot for authentic Gomantak-style seafood. Their fish thali and Sol Kadhi are local staples.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Sanman Restaurant, Israel Lane, Alibaug, Maharashtra
activities.local_secret: Order the 'Surmai Thali' — it's their freshest catch and sells out by 1:30 PM.
activities.tips: Expect a 15-minute wait during peak lunch hours.
activities.why_this_fits: Essential for experiencing the coastal culinary culture of the region.

activities.description: A white sand beach known for its rocky coastline and thrilling water sports like parasailing and banana boat rides.
activities.local_secret: The northern end of the beach is much quieter and better for photography.
activities.tips: Negotiate a package price if doing more than two activities.
activities.why_this_fits: Perfect for beach lovers seeking an adrenaline rush on the shore.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Jet skiing and parasailing at the white sands of Varsoli Beach.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Humidity is high; wear breathable linen and a wide-brimmed hat.
itinerary.evening_summary: Quiet sunset walk at Kihim Beach followed by a resort dinner.
itinerary.morning_summary: Sail across the harbor and enjoy a traditional seafood thali.
itinerary.notes: Day 1 focuses on the central and northern beach hubs.

activities.description: Historic Portuguese ruins where the walls meet the sea. Walk through ancient archways covered in vines.
activities.local_secret: There is a hidden entrance near the high school that leads directly to a secluded beach patch.
activities.tips: Wear sturdy sandals as the terrain inside the ruins is uneven.
activities.why_this_fits: Combines your love for the beach with a touch of coastal history.

activities.description: A garden cafe serving a mix of Mediterranean and Konkani fusion food in a bohemian, artistic setting.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Bohemyan Blue, Agarsure, Alibaug-Revdanda Road, Maharashtra
activities.local_secret: Try the Prawns in Coconut Milk; it's a refined take on a local classic.
activities.tips: Browse their small boutique for unique local handicrafts.
activities.why_this_fits: A 'Standard' style traveler's favorite for its aesthetic and high-quality ingredients.

activities.description: Famous for its clean sands and dense groves of Suru (Cypress) trees. Ideal for a peaceful walk.
activities.local_secret: Rent a hammock from a local vendor for ₹100 and nap under the cypress canopy.
activities.tips: Avoid the main entrance; walk 200m left for a private feel.
activities.why_this_fits: The cleanest beach in the area, perfect for a relaxing end to the trip.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Chilled cafe lunch followed by relaxation under cypress trees.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Afternoon sun is intense; stay hydrated and use SPF 50.
itinerary.evening_summary: Final beach stroll at Nagaon before catching the return ferry.
itinerary.morning_summary: Explore the ruins of a Portuguese fort right on the beach.
itinerary.notes: Day 2 explores the quieter, more scenic southern coast.

money_saving_hacks: Use the 'Ro-Ro' passenger ferry (₹400) instead of the 'Starboard' class (₹800-1200).
Eat at 'Khanavals' (local home-run eateries) for dinner to save on food costs.
overall_vibe: You will trade Mumbai's skyline for swaying cypress trees and salty sea breezes. This trip balances adrenaline-pumping water sports with serene sunsets and authentic Malvani seafood in a premium boutique setting.
packing_tips: Power bank for long days outdoors.
Waterproof phone pouch for water sports.
smart_insights: Book the M2M Ferries online to secure your preferred time slot, especially on weekends.
Hire a dedicated auto-rickshaw for the full day to save 30% compared to individual rides.

travel_between_cities.alternative: Speedboat from Gateway of India (₹2500, 20 min)
travel_between_cities.tips: Check for seasonal cancellations during monsoon (June-Sept).
The evening ferry offers a great view of the sunset over the ocean.

trip_title: Alibaug Coastal Escape: Beaches, Forts & Konkani Flavors
validation_warnings: Some activities may have generic names (e.g.: Sanman Restaurant, Revdanda Fort, Nagaon Beach). For more specific recommendations, try providing more detailed preferences.
Note: Individual day costs sum to ₹16,300, which differs from the stated total of ₹20,000. Transport between cities may account for this difference.
